column5: Had a keeper in the boat today !!! Water is still 40.7F in the main Sound.  Not sure how many guys here have a wife that would be wanting to go Muskie fishing in December, but I think I'm a pretty fortunate lad!
Looks sexy and in leg warmers too. LOL  Nice
A lot better than Terry did on Saturday I can tell you that!!

Had a keeper in the boat today !!! Water is still 40.7F in the main Sound.  Not sure how many guys here have a wife that would be wanting to go Muskie fishing in December, but I think I'm a pretty fortunate lad!  My wife is honestly my favorite person to have with me in the boat fishing.  Nice little update post there.
A lot better than Terry did on Saturday I can tell you that!!  He forgot his leg warmers?
You're a lucky man, Wayne.  Sounds like a perfect day.

Pushed the boat back into it's winter resting spot today and prepared to block the trailer in the air and clean out the boat. It dawned on me that my usual routine is to winterize the live wells and power washer pump, change the oils etc in both engines when I bring the boat home from Temagami in late September and then Musky fish a few times in the Fall before putting her away to splash the fresh oils around. Of course I did that in October 2014 and then the boat never moved until this Falls Musky hunt. I popped the cowling to read what the engine time was last round ( I write in sharpie on the side of the case) to find that we put 96 hours on the Verado this fall trolling for 'skis, so instead of blocking I decided it best to do the old $140 oil / filter change so she's ready for Spring. Guess I'll block it tomorrow..
96 hours of trolling is a lot of miles on your baits... Good for you getting out that much
At least we know one fish lives in that 400 miles of water Mike!!

to find that we put 96 hours on the Verado this fall trolling for 'skis,  Maybe time to set up a new trolling plan for next year Wayne, lotsa fun being out there in the fall but 96 hours of solid fishing and only one small fish for your efforts sounds like your fishing some pretty unproductive waters.
Hey look at the flip side...  Maybe you just eliminated around 399.5 miles of unproductive water...

The path has served Andy (and myself) pretty well over the years and we stick to pretty much the same humps and bumps, although we also tried a lot of new water this year due to wind direction and me going against the "captains" directions. Lots of other boats out there from time to time, never saw a net come out on any of them. Water is still 41 degrees in the Sound. Maybe we are chasing the urban myth...

The path has served Andy (and myself) pretty well over the years and we stick to pretty much the same humps and bumps, although we also tried a lot of new water this year due to wind direction and me going against the "captains" directions. Lots of other boats out there from time to time, never saw a net come out on any of them. Water is still 41 degrees in the Sound. Maybe we are chasing the urban myth...

Maybe we are chasing the urban myth...  Not a myth Wayne, the bigguns are in there for sure, you just have to keep digging for them.  One of these days you'll get your reward and it'll all be worthwhile.

If there is anyone that deserves a reward it's Wayne and it will come. Just spending that much time on the water is probably something he needed. Wayne spent some quality time on the water with good people, so not all was lost.
No laughs for "anal glaucoma"?  Thats fricken hilarious???  You sure have patience!
good on you wayne for getting out!  I'm sure "boat time" is great for you.  Look forward to your temagami reports this winter.  I hope you're doing well...Cheers.

Thanks Kevin, we're hanging in there and just keeping busy fishing, firewood and tinkering on the old cars instead of airplanes. Gives my mind a new path to follow.  Yesterday, exact same time (3:50), during the Major, and my Plow disappeared with a snap in open water. Always check for frays... we'll never know how big it was, but it's wearing expensive jewelry unfortunately.

eeesh.  Tough one.  She'll be back...and keep you coming too.  It's kiddo hockey time here...boat goes into hibernation this weekend...unfortunately she's been sunbathing in the driveway for weeks...I'm sure you have a few more hours out there yet though!  Good luck and all the best...glad to here you are coping well and hanging in!  Cheers!
I've never been to g bay in my life...  That's probably why you can't relate.   I could do 150 hours and be on the edge of my seat the whole time.

That's probably why you can't relate.   I could do 150 hours and be on the edge of my seat the whole time.   Naa,as good or better within 30 mins of where Mike and I are.  No 150 hrs per fish here or the biggies wouldnt have people to chase them. Everyone gets lucky tho' no matter where you are. Right pass with a bait being presented properly just puts the odds in your favour a little bit. The rest is up to a dumb fish.

It's not that I can't relate... That's not what I'm saying at all...  I'm saying if I went that long on a water body without a fish I woulda quit and spent my time elsewhere... Irish is just way more patient then me...  Example... The Ottawa river... Can't catch a fish there... Been up there 3 times for around 30-36 hours total.... No fish boated... I've had follows... I've had hits... I'm fishing the same structure as everyone else... Just can't seal the deal... The only reason I go is because it's a shollow water fishery with great casting opportunities... Now that I've done better casting on the st lawrence this year I'm not sure if I'll ever go back to the Ottawa...

Naa,as good or better within 30 mins of where Mike and I are.  No 150 hrs per fish here or the biggies wouldnt have people to chase them. Everyone gets lucky tho' no matter where you are. Right pass with a bait being presented properly just puts the odds in your favour a little bit. The rest is up to a dumb fish.  I would guess it's better, I see Mike's fish pics. Not doubting that.  None of us are on the same page here. I can't speak for Wayne, but there's something special about G Bay and the French and it can cough up giants. Just the exposed Canadian shield in the background in that picture gets my heart going. This probably makes no sense to you guys.

It depends what your after...  Not exactly a romantic scenery everywhere on the st lawrence river...  And it's a very busy waterway...  Ships going by every hour or so...  I bet g bay is a really nice getaway... And nobody can argue there are giants there...

Just the exposed Canadian shield in the background in that picture gets my heart going. This probably makes no sense to you guys.  I'm agreeing with you 110% on the scenery Chris, it makes a huge difference on a fishing trip. I spend alot of time fishing muskies on the West Arm of Nipissing and the place is gorgeous, very similar to parts of GBay & the French with the granite & pines. I've often said I could fish for a week and get skunked but still come home saying it was a fabulous trip.  Lake St. Clair puts up some huge fish but offers absolutely nothing in the way of scenery and to me that makes a huge difference in a trip.  Some nice fish but nothing to go with them.

Only been to GBay once and Nip about ten trips and agree with you on the scenery. But you got to cut LSC a break, not much to look at but the fish are willing to play and the company is usually pretty good

Shooting the breeze with buddies, or just clearing the heavy fog from your heart while trolling some of the most scenic shorelines, And a decent fish to kick the stink as a bonus. Every outing doesn't have to be a competing tournament about catching numbers or monsters. I say, WTG ! Nice fish!

Nothing big, caught with no less than 80 feet left on our trolling path before packing things up at 4 today. Caught at 3:56  Came on Andy's line, my boat. He reeled it in, clipped the hooks etc but I get the picture, it's how we troll !!  Good one Wayne! Checked the solunar tables and lunar tables that day both were in your favour. Plus great scenery, chance at massive muskie and getting to check out your neighbourhood . Nice way to spend free time!

Well looky here!!!  While away the dood's did play.  Andy? Heard he gave up fishing.  No.  Never!  Just like this guy didn't either.  Team NoQuit!    That's too many hours Wayner.  Betchya that one felt fantastic.... for the both of yas!
Out again Friday, maybe we'll really slim the boat this time with a giant! ... not that we really care!
Dang dood!  What a long awesome fall for fishing.  You're right, why would you care, these are the bonus rounds anyways.
Friday !!! Lol Wayne ?,my boats been away a month already ,go get them Esox ..good luck
go get em boys.
i can only dream of how bloody fat a Gbay ski would be this late...oh boy
Out again Friday, maybe we'll really slim the boat this time with a giant! ... not that we really care!  In shorts and T,s I,ll bet. LOL
Maybe a rain coat for the morning B, but after that the sun is supposed to come out. Saturday looks MINT as well !
Oh ya, Saturday is going to be a sweet day.  Good luck out there byes.
Good luck!
In shorts and T,s I,ll bet. LOL  I,ll bet this didnt happen today out there,,,,,,,,,,,,
Maybe a rain coat for the morning B, but after that the sun is supposed to come out. Saturday looks MINT as well ! Saturday and Sunday look great, we'll be out there both days

I bet you enjoyed every hour out there Wayne. The sound of the water laping against the boat... lord knows you would hear it as you can't tell you engines are running unless you hear it pissing! Congrats to you and Andy on the fish. You didn't by chance pluck an eye ball for perch bait? HH
Nice Wayne. Glad to see you're getting out and enjoying yourself.

personally id still rather haul in smallies on the bay then fish 60 hours for one ski on the bay...but thats just me.  Personally I am still in the mentality that one day while tossing big baits for trophy pike a bigger ski is gonna cross paths with me.  Nice catch though! The cleanest skis come outta the bay thats for sure.
Wayne and Andy know full well what they are doing and are enjoying themselves doing it.
Time well spent I'd say, nice fish!
Nice fish Wayne. Keep putting in the hours and the big ones will happen.
Wayne and Andy know full well what they are doing and are enjoying themselves doing it.

You keep playing with that bait Akrisoner, I'd probably fish for them too if I didn't have 168 free hours, per week, to spend doing what I want, after 5+ years of living to someone else's medical schedule.  Oh and BTW Mister G, you must have cooked them wrong because Musky is better than Pike if you steak them right!
Cruising around on Georgian Bay with a good friend for 60 hrs sounds just about perfect.  The fish is a bonus.

oh dear....60 hours. I don't have the fortitude yet, gotta see some kind of results. Having said that, I may only fish 60 hours for the whole season! If I could fish all kinds, then a search for a true giant would interest me.
Better (really) late than never!
Nice catch Wayne, would like one of those for myself one day!

You keep playing with that bait Akrisoner, I'd probably fish for them too if I didn't have 168 free hours, per week, to spend doing what I want, after 5+ years of living to someone else's medical schedule.  Oh and BTW Mister G, you must have cooked them wrong because Musky is better than Pike if you steak them right!  he he, dont worry i keep throwin them back to feed the skis when i catch em  Honest question, how many pike did you hammer prior to the ski? You guys must have loaded the boat with some decent snakes?
That's the surprising thing, not a single pike to stink up the boat.

Ouch... At least pike would have entertained you a bit...  Don't know how people can fish these slow fisheries...  If I had to fish 2-3-4-5 days to get a fish I'd quit musky fishing... I'm dead serious...  I hear these g bay and nip reports of week long trips with only a few bites for their efforts...  I mean I have a day here and there without wetting my net but no way I could fish 60 hours for 1 bite... Even if every one was a 50 I still couldn't go 5-6 days of fishing for 1 bite...  Hopefully you next trip has some more action
nice going

Ouch... At least pike would have entertained you a bit...  Don't know how people can fish these slow fisheries...  If I had to fish 2-3-4-5 days to get a fish I'd quit musky fishing... I'm dead serious...  I hear these g bay and nip reports of week long trips with only a few bites for their efforts...  I mean I have a day here and there without wetting my net but no way I could fish 60 hours for 1 bite... Even if every one was a 50 I still couldn't go 5-6 days of fishing for 1 bite...  Hopefully you next trip has some more action I agree 100%.......some areas of Ontario are living by myths of the old days while other areas are excellent fisheries.

Ouch... At least pike would have entertained you a bit...  Don't know how people can fish these slow fisheries...  If I had to fish 2-3-4-5 days to get a fish I'd quit musky fishing... I'm dead serious...  I hear these g bay and nip reports of week long trips with only a few bites for their efforts...  I mean I have a day here and there without wetting my net but no way I could fish 60 hours for 1 bite... Even if every one was a 50 I still couldn't go 5-6 days of fishing for 1 bite...  Hopefully you next trip has some more action how come you did not quit after you were skunked for 150 straight on the bay?
I've never been to g bay in my life...

Let's not forget guys, there's lots of BIG muskies in GBay and plenty of guys do very well at catching them.  You just need to know where they are.  Graham Bristow is a perfect example.  https://www.google.ca/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0CBwQFjAAahUKEwj7yJ-ixY3JAhWJXB4KHa25ARs&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ontariomusky.com%2FYour_Guide.html&usg=AFQjCNFHE3ZjrWFsPgQr5suZM7gEd1PoIg
I've never been to g bay in my life... My bad. Wrong Mike ....

anyone can catch dink bass absolutely, but we are learning..and I would argue not anyone can get a 20lb bag.  but dont get me wrong, I fish everything on the bay except specifically targeting musky.  Part of the thing is that everyone on here thinks that G bay basically means moon river. Moon river seems to have the best fishing on the bay, especially for musky.  To those questioning the fishery on GBay...its one of the best i have fished, its also one of the most challenging due to size and exposure, its also probably one  of the most beautiful making every moment on it that much more worth it.
Nice to see a live one this time around Wayne  :)

Nothing big, caught with no less than 80 feet left on our trolling path before packing things up at 4 today. Caught at 3:56  Came on Andy's line, my boat. He reeled it in, clipped the hooks etc but I get the picture, it's how we troll !!
Not a bad way to spend 60 hrs! Especially with the weather last week.  Nice fish!
Andy? Heard he gave up fishing.  Nice to see ya getting out there Wayne. Nice fish guys.
Nah.. he sold his boat, but certainly isn't giving up on fishing.
Nice to see
Nah.. he sold his boat, but certainly isn't giving up on fishing.  Dang, That means I,ll have to move of his ice fishing spots now. LOL  Good to hear .
could have been worse, you could have caught that in the first 4 minutes of your 60 hrs
60 hours...  Ouch  Nice catch tho
That's patience for sure. Good on you to hang in there

Any decent ski like that from G Bay or the French is somehow worth about 20 skis from the Kawarthas or Haliburton IMO. I'd rather fish fall skis and get skunked where you guys were than catch a couple on Balsam.

Only net that we've seen hit the water from any of the boats out in the past 3 weeks and no "chatter" as to anyone catching fish. Anyone is welcome to come up and  show us how it's done. Edit as Chris posted same time, I'd do a thousand fish free hours on Georgian Bay before constantly pulling weeds on Scugog ever again!
Sweet ! Wish I had more time to get out for some fall fishing.  Good shooting Wayne.
Great catch, hard work rewarded....
Nice! Tell Andy I said hi. Hope to see him on the ice! Just trolling the bay with the pair of you would be a blast, never mind actually catching!  S.
I'm pretty sure we'll be out again next week Shayne... do you feel a cold coming on or the arrival of anal glaucoma (can't see my  coming to work)
Im away hunting next week. My fishing takes a back seat now til ice up.....gotta kill meat lol
Nice fish wayne! In my boat its a boat fish too?

Good stuff!!!! Persistence pays dividends!! GBay has been pretty tight with the big 'skis this year. I have a couple friends who were out daily for the past few weeks and were skunked. They usually get some nice supertankers every year (last years fatty was a 54 out of HH).
nice fish Wayne.
Better than smelling like skunk. Just an appetizer. Good luck .
Hard work pays off eventually.  Nice catch
Nice fish Wayne!  I'm not so sure my patience would enable me to land 1 fish in 60 hours of trolling!  LOL!

Nice fish Wayne!  I'm not so sure my patience would enable me to land 1 fish in 60 hours of trolling!  LOL! I agree, 59 hours and 50 minutes of boredom for one fish that tastes like crap is not my cup of tea either.
Good to see you boys finally got into one Wayne.
Good to see you two were rewarded for your efforts. Beats the heck of what I've been doing
